text: A die is thrown once. Probability of getting a prime number is: [SSC 2016]
A coin is tossed once. Probability of getting a tail is: [SSC 2017]
A card is drawn from a well-shuffled deck. Probability that it is a red card is: [SSC 2018]
From a bag of 5 red and 3 blue balls, one is drawn. Probability it is blue is: [SSC 2019]
Two coins are tossed. Probability of getting at least one head is: [SSC 2020]
A die is thrown once. Probability of getting an even number is: [SSC 2016]
A card is drawn. Probability it is an ace is: [SSC 2021]
A bag has 10 balls numbered 1 to 10. Probability of drawing a ball with number multiple of 3 is: [Predicted 2025]
A card is drawn. Probability that it is neither king nor queen is: [SSC 2019]
Probability of getting 7 when a die is thrown is: [SSC 2017]
Probability of any event lies between 0 and 1. [SSC 2016]
Probability of a sure event is 0. [SSC 2017]
The probability of drawing a king from 52 cards is 4/52. [SSC 2018]
The sum of probabilities of all outcomes of an experiment is 1. [SSC 2019]
When a coin is tossed once, sample space has 3 outcomes. [Predicted 2025]
Probability of drawing an ace from 52 cards is 1/52. [SSC 2020]
In a fair die, all six outcomes are equally likely. [SSC 2021]
If bag has 2 red and 3 blue balls, probability of red is 3/5. [Predicted 2025]
Probability of impossible event is 0. [SSC 2016]
Probability of drawing a face card from a deck is 12/52. [SSC 2018]
Find probability of getting odd number when a die is rolled. [SSC 2019]
One card is drawn from 52. Find probability it is a heart. [SSC 2016]
A coin is tossed twice. Find probability of getting exactly one head. [SSC 2020]
answer: Sample space = {HH, HT, TH, TT}. Exactly one head = {HT, TH} = 2 outcomes. Total = 4. Probability = 2/4 = 1/2.

text: From a pack of 52, probability of getting black card. [SSC 2018]
A die is rolled. Probability of getting number greater than 4. [SSC 2017]
From a bag of 6 red and 4 blue balls, one is drawn. Find probability it is red. [SSC 2019]
A card is drawn. Find probability it is neither ace nor king. [SSC 2020]
Two dice are rolled. Probability of getting sum 7. [SSC 2018]
A card drawn is a black face card. Probability? [SSC 2017]
answer: Black suits = 26 cards. Face cards = J,Q,K ⇒ 6 black face cards. Probability = 6/52 = 3/26.

text: A die is thrown. Probability of getting number not divisible by 3. [Predicted 2025]
Probability of drawing a queen or king from a pack. [SSC 2019]
Two coins are tossed. Probability of getting no head. [SSC 2018]
answer: Sample space={HH,HT,TH,TT}. No head={TT}=1. Total=4. Probability=1/4.

text: A card drawn is a spade. Probability? [SSC 2017]
A die is rolled. Probability of prime number greater than 2. [Predicted 2025]
A card is drawn. Probability of red king. [SSC 2016]
Two dice are thrown. Find probability of getting (i) both numbers even, (ii) at least one odd. [SSC 2019]
answer: (i) Even outcomes per die = {2,4,6}=3. So total =3×3=9. Probability=9/36=1/4. (ii) At least one odd = 1−P(both even)=1−1/4=3/4.

text: From a bag of 4 red, 5 black, 7 white balls, one is drawn. Find probability of (i) black, (ii) not red. [SSC 2020]
Two cards drawn at random from 52 without replacement. Probability both are aces. [SSC 2017]
A die is rolled twice. Find probability of getting (i) same number on both, (ii) different numbers. [SSC 2018]
Three coins are tossed. Find probability of (i) 3 heads, (ii) exactly 2 heads, (iii) at least 1 tail. [SSC 2016]
answer: Sample space=8. (i) {HHH}=1 ⇒ P=1/8. (ii) {HHT, HTH, THH}=3 ⇒ P=3/8. (iii) At least 1 tail = 1−P(no tail)=1−1/8=7/8.

text: From 52 cards, one drawn. Find probability of (i) red face card, (ii) black non-face card. [SSC 2021]
answer: (i) Red face=6 ⇒ P=6/52=3/26. (ii) Black cards=26, face=6 ⇒ non-face=20 ⇒ P=20/52=5/13.

text: Two dice thrown. Find probability that sum ≥ 10. [SSC 2022]
A bag has 3 red, 4 green, 5 blue balls. Two are drawn together. Find probability (i) both green, (ii) one red & one blue. [Predicted 2025]
From 52 cards, one card drawn. Probability that it is (i) not a heart, (ii) neither ace nor spade. [Predicted 2025]
answer: (i) Hearts=13 ⇒ not heart=39 ⇒ P=39/52=3/4. (ii) Ace=4, Spades=13, but ace of spades counted twice ⇒ total=16. Not ace/spade=36 ⇒ P=36/52=9/13.

text: A card drawn. Find probability it is (i) jack or queen, (ii) number card (2–10). [SSC 2019]
Two dice thrown. Find probability of (i) sum=8, (ii) sum not equal to 7. [Predicted 2025]
Three coins tossed. Find probability of (i) at least 2 heads, (ii) at most 2 tails. [SSC 2020]
answer: Sample=8. (i) At least 2 heads={HHT,HTH,THH,HHH}=4 ⇒ P=4/8=1/2. (ii) At most 2 tails=8−P(3 tails)=8−1=7 outcomes ⇒ 7/8.

text: A bag has 5 red, 3 black, 2 white balls. One drawn. Find probability of (i) white, (ii) not black, (iii) red or black. [SSC 2016]
answer: Total=10. (i) White=2 ⇒ 2/10=1/5. (ii) Not black=7 ⇒ 7/10. (iii) Red or black=5+3=8 ⇒ 8/10=4/5.
